Dead by Daylight...
-pomysł na grę: iście zacny
-wykonanie: niektóre elementy pozostawiają wiele do życzenia jak np. hitboxy. Lecz mimo wszystko nie jest ono na jakimś tragicznym poziomie
-gameplay: tu wszystko zależy od tego na kogo trafimy i czego od gry oczekujemy
No i kilka słów podsumowania. może i gra nie jest w perfekcyjnym stanie technicznym, ale devsi starają się to wszystko ogarniać nieraz z dobrym skutkiem nieraz z gorszym ale starają się to wszystko ogarnąć. Gra nie jest p2w lecz mimo wszystko aktualny próg wejścia w tą grę jest dość spory lecz mimo wszystko da się grać w miarę przyjemnie.

Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs, I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!

Here are the ingredients you will need!

Ravioli Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 pinch salt, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 tablespoons water.

Ravioli Filling: 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese, 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup provolone cheese, shredded, 1 egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.

Pesto-Alfredo Cream Sauce: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce, 2 cups heavy cream, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.


1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil, 2 eggs, and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand; use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.

2. Knead the dough until smooth, 8 to 10 minutes; add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

3. While the dough is resting, prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese, egg, and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.

4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream, raise the heat to high, and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.

5. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, warm the marinara sauce over medium-low heat.

6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.

7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli, brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta, pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.

8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli, and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot, 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.

9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown, about 4 minutes.

10. To serve the ravioli, divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.

Dead by Daylight has the same capacity to induce a keyboard smashing rage on par with Rainbow 6 Siege. With killers as fun and engaging as Hag who will stomp you and your team out before first gen and under 5 minutes or getting cross map sniped by Huntress to stop you inches from the door, you will have a great time with your friends. 50% or more of your time in this game will be queues and the rest is getting obliterated by 1 or 2 killers that everyone uses. Despite these egregious oversights on the dev teams part, there are an abundance of fun killers and interesting game mechanics. With more balancing that would hopefully fill the queues with a more varied killer choice this game could be even better.

Este juego la única manera de recomendarlo es jugándolo en personalizadas con amigos.

Ya que de otra manera la experiencia te la arruinará el asesino con perks bastantes tochas (y memento mori para un punto de sal) o los supervivientes humillándote y siendo peores que una mosca cojonera.

En resumen, matchmaking inexistente (literal) y una comunidad muy infantil, mediocre y tan toxica que tienes que llegar una máscara de gas.
Buenisimo el juego, lo tengo en pc,celu, xbox y ps4 ... recomendable y bueno para pasar unos ratos riendose, aunque algunas veces te reviente la paciencia jajajaj

This game used to be fun, but now there are so many problems and the devs won't fix any of it, they don't care at all.

Things that NEED to be fixed/changed:

- So many bugs and glitches where you get stuck until the round ends or where survivors can reach places that the killer can't (I'm looking at you, western map!)
- One of the most toxic communities I've ever seen in a game (it's like playing with spoiled 5 years old)
- No voice or text chat for crossplayers (I mean really, you are supposed to WORK TOGETHER as survivors)
- Facecamping and tunneling as killer (there's no fun at all for the camped survivor, let the killer get a blurred vision if he camps too long. Especially since survivors aren't allowed to camp either, they even get a raven above them while dying on the ground!)
- Trolling killers who let everyone bleed to death while survivors can do nothing but wait (give them at least the option to kill themselves so no more waste of time)
- Trolling survivors who run around other survivors and openly mark them for the killer (give the survivors the ability to kick other survivors from the game if all agree)
- The ranking system is complete useless trash which says nothing abour your skill (it doesn't matter if you're red rank once you get facecamped by the next rank 16 killer or if a trolling survivor marks your location for the killer or you get stuck in the environment etc.)
- So many hackers in this game! Killers see you from the start or teleport behind you without having such perks or abilities, survivors know the hatch location before it even appears (without offering) or know all perks from the killer while still standing in the starting lobby
- No other game modes besides the usual "repair 5 gens and escape" (How about who gets the most totems? Or lets find something which is hidden on the map? Or let 2 killers compete against each other who gets the most kills before the survivors escape? Just saying)
- The waiting time to find a lobby is horrible, there are times when you have to wait about 10-15min. Every day. The more people you are in a group, the longer you have to wait, despite the fact that you need less players

And the devs won't fix any of it or ban any toxic or hacking players. They just bring out new content with even more bugs and care for nothing but the money. Once you've given them your money, you are no longer of interest for them and if you have a bug which resets your levels or items, they won't even lift a finger. And if your paid DLC characters somehow get locked again, you have to buy them again. Because it's not their problem, they already have your money. So think carefully before buying.
